text: 0,375l bottle at home shared with Saeglopur. BB 23.11.2025. Vintage 2015 / 2016. very nice redish color, small white head. smells funk, barnyard, cheese, some light berry notes, wood, bit grassy, some green apples. very lovely funky notes. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes grassy, citric, funky, some cheese, wood, light berry notes, light vinegar, acetone. finishes very dry and lightly sour with notes of cheese, vinegar and citric notes. very nice one, very lovely cheesy notes, very good to drink, gets just a tad too vinegarish once it warms up.

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2017 375 ml bottle, bb 23/11/2025, shared by Werckmeister, thanks!
Deep red body, with a small, creamy, off-white head. 
Aroma of funk, cheese, sour fruits, the berries not that obvious, unripe pears, apples, horse blanket. 
Tastes quite similar, while the blackberries are coming more through. 
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with an average carbonation. 
Finishes sour, medium dry, very fruity, with sour berries, pears, apples, some funk. 

Tasty. The funk notes are dominating, but the sour berries are also coming through, especially in the taste. My favourite Tilquin so far, really diverse and not as puckeringly acidic as the other ones Ive had.
Ar/Ap/T/P/Ov: 8/4/8/4/16
Pours a reddish orange wth minimal faint around the rim lacing. The aroma is blackberry, butter, cracker and vinegar. Faint carbonation

Bottled. 35cl sample. The aroma has berries, some barnyard. Bit hazy, red coloured beer with a light pink head. The taste is light-moderate sour, has lots of berries, some lactics, barnyard, tartness. Nice, refreshing. Decent.

Bottle. Pours clody pinkish-copperish almost no head. Aroma: shitty old toilet wheres all the walls are covered with piss, berries, some raw apple peals. Taste: heavy acidity, medium sour, raw apples, berries,vinegar. Its not beer for a amatour. Medium body.Acidity finish.Kills mine stomache but I like it and in same time its smooth. How is it possible?.

Toer de Gueze 2017. Bottle at Gueuzerie Tilquin. Deep bordeaux with no head. The aroma has lots of berries, juice, lollipop and sugar candy. Very fruity flavor, sweetish and sourish with notes of lemon, citrus, berries, wood, vanilla and some spiciness. Slightly dry, medium-bodied.
Hazy pink colour. Aroma has a lot of berries. Taste is grapes and a bouquet of forest berries. Super crisp texture.

Bottle at Gueuzerie Tilquin during Toer de Gueze 2017. Hazy pink red. Aroma of forest berries, wood and barnyard. Sour berries, green fruits, vanilla, fruity jam, wood, tasty and balanced. Full-bodied, smooth and oily. Great.

Merci à Marc-André pour le partage! Une bière que je souhaitais boire depuis longtemps. Sa belle robe rouge et profonde hurlait mon nom depuis un bon moment déjà. Ce qui ma le plus plu chez elle? Lintégration du fruit dont jamais ne souffre la gueuze de base qui demeure au centre de tout ce qui se passe tant dans mes narines que dans ma bouche. Très sèche bien que ample, la mûre se transforme petit à petit en framboise bien rouge. Oui le fruit aurait pu être davantage présent mais à mon avis la grande qualité de cette bière réside dans léquilibre en regard à la gueuze de base. Chapeau Pierre, et merci!

Bottle. Pours a cloudy purple-hued orange body with a medium white head. Nose is lemon juice, barnyard funk, red berries, lactic acid and hints of hay, citric peel and red fruits. Taste is lactic acid tones, grape peel, red berries, barnyard funk and hints of red fruits, hay and citric tones. Light body, high carbonation. Crisp, tart and very tasty blend from Tilquin, although the blackberries dont come through much.

Bottle shared at KyotoLeftys 10,000th rating celebration. Tart, rich berry nose, lots of funk, slightly stinky. Bright pink/amber color. Sharp, tart berries, plenty of tannins, leather, wood. Thin body, with some tannin roughness on the tongue. Very nice. Great blend.

Bottle, shared at my 10K rating celebration. Deep red-orange-purple color with lace. Dusty, dry nose, grapefruit, blackberry, leather. Creamy, fruit flavor, leather, lemon, dust, lots of leather, horse blanket, fruit. Tannic, dry and woody. Bitter, tannic finish. The blackberries do not stand out as much as the lambic funk.

(Tilquin Oude Mûre à lAncienne) Bottle 375ml at home, served into a tumbler. ABV 6.4%
Deep red coloured body, mostly clear , bubbly head. 
Fruity aroma with red wine lemons. 
Very sour taste, some blackberry on the finish, lemons, red wine, wood. 
Medium thin body, good carbonation, tart on the palate. 
Very good.
Kwaśność, owocowość, skóra, stajnia, wszystko jest na miejscu. Naprawdę petarda.

My Bottom Line:
Citrusy acidity and the usual Lambic funk dominate the blackberries in this pleasant creation.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A slice of foam floats atop the cloudy purplish red.
-The blackberries could be brighter.
-Acidity levels are relatively high, but the beer remains quite drinkable.
-This one is strangely more lambic-y than fruity.

Bottle.

Tasted on 4/14/17 from a corked and caged 375ml bottle. Pours muted, cloudy blood red with a thin head that leaves thin bubbly lace. The nose is all the funky burnt rubber and lemon peel with just a faint hint of some juicy blackberry. The flavor is super sour, all the lemon and funk, very light fruit. The body is medium and tannic with under average carbonation and a long funky and sour finish.

Bottle picked up at Dranken Vande Woude, Pervijde Diksmuide, consumed at home Sunday 9th April whilst making a Rhubarb Crumble Ice Cream for tea tonight.  Pours a rich blood red colour with a head that departed before I was able to check it out. This is so fruity its like zappy, fruity, tart and tangy, hedgerow extravaganza, utterly marvellous. Sour but not aggressively so, its like the summer has arrived and on a stunning day like today it has.  A7 A4 T9 P5 Ov17 4.2
Bottle pour at ACBF2017. Pours hazy red with off-white head. Fruity, berries, citrus, funk, some wood, soft carbonation, moderate acidity. Easy drinkable, medium bodied. Loved it.
w zapachu spora dzikość, jest trochę jeżyn. W smaku jeżyna również występuje, jest dosyć wodniście z delikatnie ściągającą cierpkością.

Nice funky and cherry aroma, quite leathery and barnyard up-front. Slightly apricot, apple, earthy and citric. Taste is moderately to light heavy sour with the plums in the background. Medium body, oily texture, soft to average carbonation. In overall nice, moderately sour and dry, strong tart accents esp. in the end. After warming-up more tart and vinous.

Bottle, 75cl corked. It pours an unclear dark orange to amber colored body under a minimal sized off-white head. The aroma is funky and lightly berry-ish, with lemon, barnyard, chicken manure and leather. Its funky on the palate too, lemony and tart, with a pleasant carbonation level. Berries, funk, leather, lemon juice and barnyard notes in the flavor. Lasting finish. Quite lovely this one, with a sublte berry touch. Love it. 170311

Bottle 750ml @ geokkjer
Pours hazy/murky amber/purple with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, blackberry, horse blanket, barnyard, funky, tart and citrus finish. Taste is light sweet and medium to heavy sour with a long dry, blackberry, funky, tart and citrus finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle. Pours murky purple with a tiny off-white head. Aroma of funk, berries, lemon and barnyard. Flavor is sour and sweet with blackberries, funk, wood, some lemon and tart barnyard. Medium body, average carbonation.

2015/2016Bottle poured into a taster showing unfiltered dark reddish copper with clean white foam lacing. 

The nose shows tart bretty funk with notes of light blackberry. 

The palate is medium bodied and highly carbonated. Moderately tart with flavors of moderately intense tart blackberries.

Bue en bouteille de 37.5cl à la maison
Couleur violette, belle mousse colorée, belle dentelle avec une grosse effervescence
Nez sur la mûre, et lacidité avec un côté lactique.
Attaque sur la mûre et le lambic acide et bel équilibre sur une pointe piquante cest très agréable mais elle manque de longueur sur la mûre...
UPDATED: MAR 4, 2017 ACBF, 04.03.2017: weinrot, trüb. Im Aroma Brombeere, Säure und Brettanomyces. Geschmacklich ähnlich. Sehr erfrischend trotz dass es trocken ist. Sehr gut. Danke JFB!!!
Hazy red with white head. Funky, grapefruit, blackberries and citrus. Fruity, dry and acidic finish. Amazing!
Bottle@ akkurat Stockholm. Pours a amber redish colour beer with a small head. Bretty, fruity, yeasty and woody with a well balanced taste of blackberries. Dry finish.

0.375 l bottle from De Bierboom, best before November 2025, so probably a bit more than year old. Clear, orangeish red with a thin, fluffy, slowly diminishing, white head. Very sourish, dusty, quite funky and moderately fruity aroma of lemon, rhubarb, rose hips, blackberries and leather. Very sour, fruity, dusty and slightly funky taste of lots of lemon and rhubarb, leather, some blackberries and a touch of rose hips, followed by a medium long, rather tart, woody-dry and dusty finish. Medium body, very astringent, dry and slightly effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Nice, but very sour, definitely lacks balance and complexity as well. Not what I would call an elegant fruit lambic, quite monotonous and with lots of acidity.

Bottle at Gentle Boozers in Rome-Italy. Amber dark cloudy pour, off-white/amber foam. Nose: defiantly blackberries, misty notes, funky. Mouth: mild blackberries mixed with easy funky notes, fruity, peppery finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle shared at The Flamingo Resort. Hazy reddish brown color. Aromas of vinegar, berries, cherries, funk. Tastes of cherries, berries, tart funk. Light body with a dry finish.

29.01.2017, 0,375l bottle @ home:
Nice slightly bubbly-creamy shortlasting head, nice deep red-orangy color. Aroma is slightly dry sour-ish fruity, old rope, sorrel, minerals, oak, berry skin, sour dark berries, soda powder, citrus acid, brett. Taste is sour-ish fruity, soda powder, sorrel, unripe dark berries, citrus acid, berry skin, oak, old rope, grass, minerals, brett. Medium bitterness, sour-ish dry mouthfeel. Nice.

Bottle. Pours cloudy, light red. Aroma is acidic, with fruit peel and berries, as well as some bretty wood and earthy notes. Medium body, with soft carbonation. Flavour is acidic, with berries and bretty wood.

Tilquin Oude Mûre Tilquin à lAncienne
Lambic Style - Fruit
747414

Lukt: Sure frukter.
Utseende: Rødbrun.
Skum/kullsyre: Lite skum.
Smak: Sure frukter.
Hvor: Bryne Tasting med Bryne, Gunnar og Untapd Geir.

Shared bottle at Bryne tasting. Pours almost clear red/Golden with no head. Aroma of sourdough, fruits. Taste is sour clean dry and crisp mouthfeel , nice tarty finish.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Appearance: hazy reddish pale to medium amber with a short loose foamy head diminishing rapidly to nothing, no lacing. (3/5) Aroma: dusty barnyard funk, green apple and plums, lemon, woody and vinous notes. (9/10) Taste: mild to moderate sweet, strong tart, mild funk. (9/10) Palate: light body, prickly to moderate carbonation, very dry tart funky finish. (4/5)

Im going to continue to damn this with faint praise to some extent, and say its very, very good - but hell if I can discern a significant difference between this and the other variants Ive had, or if I can detect any mûre (blackberry). I want to say its about as good as the original (Oude Quetsche Tilquin à lAncienne) Ive had a couple of times now, and slightly better than the avec Prunes de Namur I had last year. Unlike the situation with the avec Prunes de Namur, I dont find that this one is less bright and tart than the Oude Quetsche Tilquin à lAncienne, but rather find it to be an intensely tart yet very well-balanced Lambic, with a lovely dry finish that invites the next sip. Highly recommended. (18/20)

On bottle from Vinmonopolet in Norway, on order. 
Light brown with purple notes. Medium high aroma intensity; stable dominating, also light citrus. Medium body & complexity. Good bitterness & sourness- balances well. Very enjoyable

bottle orange flat nut dry fruit good acidity wood
arancio niente schiuma nocciola frutta secca buona acidita secca legno
Great Lambic, all about the bit hit of shark tart flavours backed by the blackberry.

Bottle at a tasting. Hazy dark reddish color with a fizzing pink head. Aroma is great, intense, loads of blackberry and funk, yeast reminiscent of 3F. Best blackberry flavor of any beer Ive ever had. Just amazingly fruit forward, yet also nicely tart and funky. Delicious AF. Great feel, prickly carbonation. Really awesome overall.

Bottle shared by Michael. Thanks man! Pour is hazy ruby with small pink head. Aroma 8 really funky and socky with light berry. Flavor is less funky and light sweet with a softly sour note. Really. Nice.

75 cl Bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy, lightly purple pour with a slight fizz that disappears. Aroma and taste of sharp, tart berries, black tea, blackcurrant, a bit of wet wood and cheesy funk. Not overly acetic but quite a bit of bite to the sourness.

Drunk from 37,5cl bottle bought from the Malting pot in Brussels. Excellent classical lambic mixed with blueberries. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 2015. Vibrant deep pink-purple in colour with soft yet spritzy carbonation. Aromas are of lactic funk, old wood, berry pulp, and lemon. Flavors are of woody sour blackberries, more earthy funk, and mild herbs. Potent lactic sourness with good acidity. Still fairly fruity, although that element has started to fade a bit.

From notes. Had at a tasting at Abu and Ashleys on December 15. 375 mL bottle, 2014/2015 vintage. The pour is a darker orange color with a thin cap of white head that fades off pretty quickly, leaving no lace. The aroma is good. There is a lot of tart and sour blackberry right up front. There is a hint of funkiness to it, but the sourness and tartness are just great and mostly fruit related. The flavor is just as good. Heavy blackberry from the onset. Its delicious. Sharp tartness with a light lemon citrus to it as well. The mouth feel is light and crisp with a great bright carbonation and a lingering fruity sourness that just lasts and puckers a little. This is really good.
12.7oz bottle. Dark ruby reddish purple color. Aggresive funky fruit aroma. Taste is soft up front, more tart blackberry in the middle, then clean finish. Nothing overwhelming but very good.

Partagée part Jaghana. Couleur pourpre trouble, très légère mousse. Nez vinaigré fruité, note vieille levures, aigrelet, acidulé. Gout fruité très acidulé, tannique, le coté mure est "naturel" mais plus sur le coté vinaigré que fruité, très acétique. Super nickel jaime bien, mais pas trop complexe.

Bottle 37,5 cl, an amber red beer without head. Nose is on lactic / lambic notes, touch of plum and red fruits, wild yeast, strawberries cream. Aroma is based on lambic notes, intense red and dark berries notes, medium acidity, tannic, vinegar. body is acid and vinegar. Finish is acetic with red fruit notes.

Bottle. Pours deep clear orange amber with a small, staying creamy, off-white head. Aroma has fine blackberries, mild caramel. Strawberries, soft tartness. Mild carbonation, fine dry and elegant mouthfeel. Flavour has elegant tartness, red wine, blackberry tartness. Some oak, vanilla, tart. Quite lovely.

Shared 2016, 750 ml. bottle poured to a snifter showing a fairly clear, rosy orange color, with modest and fleeting, soft white head foam, and almost no lacing. The nose was blackberry that was more as dark grape & skins, yeasty funk, acidity & dryness. Medium bodied, the taste was similar notes, with a very tart to sour nature that combined with the acidic character & dryness to produce a pleasant sharpness for the palate, tempered ever so slightly by a hint of vanilla, and conveyed by highly spritzy effervescence. Very nice.

Very funky aroma, with leather, barnyard, earthiness, tart apple.
Beautiful color
Very high sourness

Bottle from We Brought Beer, Balham. Pours purple red, eith some hints of orange, no head. Nose is cherry, red berries, blackberries, raspberry, strong sour and tart lactobacillus, nice bit of farmyard funk. Lots of fruit with lots of sourness. Taste is fruity, blackberries, stewed plums, raspberries, big lactobacillus tart and sourness. Mouthfeel is nice with the body of the fruit giving it the backbone it needs against the sourness. Really nice beer.

15-16 bottle. Clear pale red with a head thats immediately at the rim. Very pretty. Aroma of damp timber, bracken, lemon, berries - wouldnt have known they were blackberries. One of those (it seems from the aroma) where the fruit is an accent to the lambic. But theres more fruit in the taste, although it lacks the plump ripeness of blackberries. Sour but quite refined with lemon and slightly zingy herbal notes but little brooding funk. Lowish carbonation is very nice. Sour, no vinegar. Elegant, but I wondered whether either more fruit or more rambunctious lambic might have been even better.
Classic Tilquin. Acidic, grippy and very dry. Can not get enough of this. A pity they are so limited over here. The blackberries give it a nice tarty sweetness on the finish. Unbelievable like always

W aromacie bardzo dostojne, brettowe, dzikie, skórzane, owoce dopiero na drugim planie. W smaku podobnie, dzikość dominuje nad owocami, średni poziom kwaśności, jagodowy posmak dopełnia kompozycji. Bardzo smaczne, w pełni przekonujące, ale nie olśniewające.

Aroma: barnyard, leather, blueberry, fruity
Taste: medium sour, barnyard, blueberry, pineapple

37.5 cl bottle. Pours cloudy deep orange with a small white head. Aroma is dry, wooden, barnyard and oxidised fruity. Dry, shivering sour. Almost herbal fruity. Citric and lingering dry sour far finish.

Bottle at Moeder Lambic Original. Pours a beautiful clear ruby with a small, frothy off-white head, medium retention with light lacing. Aroma is cherries and raspberries with honey and cracker malt, moderate acidity with a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

375 mml bottle as part of the European Summer Santa, many thanks to the Beerhunter. Tasted on the 07/12/2016. My 1.000th rating. Reddish colour with no head. Aroma of blackberries, brett and funk. Taste is intense berries, some vinegar and sourish. Next one please!
750ml shared by Emily. Dry and bright. First blackberry Belgian Lambic Ive had. Murky thick body. Really thick, yeasty, fruity depth. Blackberry shines through. Deep depth. Great.
Spritziger, trocken saurer Antrunk mit intensiver Fruchtigkeit. Beerig, rund, spritzig, Bitternoten bleiben nicht aus. Langer, intensiv fruchtiger Nachhall. 10/12/12/12//12
Bottle at Drapaire. Amber colour with white head. Fruity, blackberry aroma. Sweet, blackberry, fruity, sour taste, slightly acidic. Medium body.
Flaska från SB. Ingen tydlig björnbärskaraktär men tydlig syrlig bärighet som lika gärna kunde varit vinbär. Tydlig syra men inte vass och acetisk, lite kärva tanniner. Snygg, bärig och vriktigt god.

Bottle. 
Light purple pour, small tan head. 
Both nose and taste are quite sour, but less than expected. 
Full body, soft carbonation.

(BBD 23-11-2025) La robe est rouge et la tête est disparate. Le nez porte la signature de la maison et la mûre me semble assez discrète, voire même effacée. Le goût montre un fruit qui demeure néanmoins assez timide. Ceci dit, tout de même une délicieuse concoction, extrêmement facile à boire, qui porte la signature dune maison qui assemble avec grande précision. En résumé, bon lambic qui manque de mûres.
Bottle shared at Jasons. Amberish in color with funk in nose and notes of blackberry throughout.

Tasting at Brians. 375ml bottle (thx, Jamey!). Pours a reddish color, similar to plums kompot. Aroma is typical for gueuze with some plums. Same taste. Too much of gueuze notes and not enough of fruitiness in my opinion. Very overhyped stuff.
Hazy purple red, sulphury aroma, fruit, fresh, berries, tea, brett, excellent, awesome, sour flavor, green tea, dried fruits, berries, sourish, fun, fresh, bitter, medium+ bodied.
15-16 bottle pours reddish purple color with no head. Blackberry jam, black currants, leather. Light mouth feel medium sourness.

750ml bottle from Systembolaget. Murky purple, pinkish white head, good lacing. Tart berry and citric taste, black currant, red currant. Medium carbonated, tart mouthfeel. Mature tart taste with woody notes, black currant, plums, citric and lemons. Long tart finish.

Bottle from Robert (echobeer) -- cheers! This is absolutely delicious -- the barnyard funk and sour bite youd expect from a lambic are both there, but they are balanced extremely well by the blackberries, which add a lot of aroma, a good amount of fruit flavor, and a gorgeous reddish purple color. Fantastic beer.

Bottle. Pours dense cherry red with no head. Scent is medium dense scent of sour and bitter berries, without any particular fruit note and without a strong lambic quality. Some notes of smoke/hickory? Taste is medium dense body of light lambic and blackberry properties. (Actually it contains blackcurrant) Manages to be light in flavor and acid properties anyways. Very great.

Bottled 750ml. -at the MBR Sour Beer tasting. Dark amber coloured, small off-white head, sourish blackberry nose. Tart blackberry, light lemony, touch of spices and wood with rather sour finish. Really nice one.
Strong aroma of lambic. Weak aroma of black berry. Watered down lambic taste. No trace of black berry in the taste. Soft lambic brew.
Odeur de geuze avec un tout petit peu de mure. Belle couleur rouge. Gout de lambic sans acidité. La mure ne se goute pas. Geuze soft.
Bottle sample at SBWF. Pours hazy red with no head. Really sour aroma with a sweet hint. Authentic feel.

Bottle shared at Johan, thanks! Murky reddish amber with little head. Aroma is strong, funky, fruity, red berries. Taste is sour, complex, funky, bretty, red berries, slight dried fruits, very complex and smooth.

Bottle sample at SBWF.
Red, hazy, no head.
Aroma of sour berries and blackberry. Lambic feel. Taste sour, balanced, vanilla. Lovely tart.

Appearance: Cloudy violet color. Not much head but active carbonation 

Aroma: Funky cork aroma with subtle fruit 

Taste: Blackberry jam noticabley tart with a sweet finish and tons of mellow oak

Overall: nice balance of sweet and sour. Wonderful funkiness

Tasting at Matts, corked bottle, vintage Murky red-amber color. The aroma is strong, very funky, footy, with strong berries. Sour, smooth, good Lambic character, not too funky, but with some horseblanket, and not much berries.Wonderful aroma, ok flavor.
Sample @ SBWF. Sweet and fruity with a balsamico like sourness. Heavy on the blackberries.
750ml bottle of 2015/16 release. Pours a reddy brown color with a bit of head. Lots of bitumen funk and mild sour blackberry.

Bottle sample at SBWF.
Pours red.
Blackberry aroma.
Tart taste of blackberries.

375ml 2016 bottle from trade with Marc-André F. poured in proper glassware. Yay first time with this Tilquin tumbler. Aroma: mostly black currants, cherries, cheese, subtle dust. App: hazy reddish / salmonish, minimal white head with surprisingly great retention, not much retention. Taste and palate: light body, moderate carbonation, some berries and cheese in mouth, moderate dry puckering acidity finish. Overall: well this is easy to drink even though acidity is quite puckering. Cheese is also quite present but I dont see this as bad. Good mouthfeel. Good fruitiness. I could get used to drinking this more often. If only it was more accessible. I could have drank a bigger bottle all by myself. Great job again Pierre.

375ml bottle [2015.11.23], pours a hazy reddish colour. Nose is funky, tart, sour, with subtle blackberries. Flavour is juicy, sour, and hints of blackberry but it fades off. Still very clean and lovely.
Bottle - Berry and petroleum funk. Cloudy reddish copper with a small white head. Funky Berry and tart notes. Nice.

Pours a purple colour with a thin white head. Aroma of sulfur and farts, with tart blackberry and acidity. Tastes better, with a balanced sweet and tart plum flavour to complement the lambic funk. Into it. Looking forward to seeing how it ages.

Hazy and purplish-brown. No head. The aroma has pedio, a light berryish character. Light body, acetic, again hitting me with pedio. The fruit is subtle, more of an indistinct berry. A touch of mustiness. Finish is bracing, acetic tartness, with just a hint of berry.

Aromat mocno dziki, skórzany i agrestowy z nutką winogron. Smak kwaśny lekki do średniego, średnio wytrawny, lekko słodki. W smaku skóra, porzeczki, stajnia, agrest, skórki winogron. Posmak wytrawny, lekko taniczny i owocowy.

375mL bottled November 2015, drunk 9/9/16.Good clarity, leaving sediment behind, in this soft, maroon-tinted peach-auburn beer. Rosy-tinted head is medium-sized and shows moderate to moderately-low retention.Strong blackberry character is dry, well-attenuated, lightly juicy and quite boisterously acidic. As with the two Quetsche versions, its immediately similar in that the lambic is a bit masked/dominated by the strong fruit element. Not to the point of it being problematic, but I would like more lambic character than what you get. I guess thats what you get from a young fruit lambic and an older bottle of Quetsche did prove to be significantly better than younger samples. Still, it doesnt seem to have a ton of personality and has quite an austere sourness to it, with light horseblanket and tons of bright acidity.Similar in the flavor, with tart/acidic fruits and a very dry, attenuated body. Strong lactic/acetic component, with minor lime-like brett notes and a hard cheese rind-like character on the finish. Tight carbonation and a fairly soft, malty texture. Obviously a well-made beer and brewed for extended aging. Probably better to rate them with 3-5 years age on them, honestly, though I wish there was a little more sublime funk to them when young.

A highly enjoyable offering.

Pours a clear, crimson to ruby red color, with a small, fizzy head, collapsing to a sheet of white lacing, coating the edge of the glass. 

Has a completely fruit defined nose, featuring wild berries, with a present blackberry appearance on top. These obtain a mellowing earthy note, leading to a fruit stone pit quality, with ripe, luscious fruit pulp being the most defining characteristic. This natural fruit sweetness blends very well into an overripe berry impression, revealing tart, fermented fruit among an oaken softness. Wet hay, leather and blue cheese, smooth out the fruit / sour interplay, creating a well nuanced yet genuine nose.

Drinks very soft, with almost no carbonation to detect at all, while a noteable aqueous silkness levels the beers sourness well.

Prickly, unripe blackberries are recognizable from the very beginning, revealing just the smallest amount of sweetness, which you typically get from the berries outer skin, together with a whiff of elder bush and an organic, young wood impression, from smelling a wet twig. The beer turns even more sour then, with a pungent, dry tartness, covering lemon peel and a whiff of vinegar, almost completely getting soaked up by prominent wood bark, while teaming up with black pepper hull and dusty sponge. Finishes with a mineralic quality, and utmost dry, crisp lemon together with foliage leaves, coating up truly unripe blackberries, which are still detectable, but limited to add more profile to the very present lime, rather than produce a mentionable depth of flavors on their own.

I really appreciate the natural depth of blackberry in this, featuring its pulp, skin and stone pits facets, together with a zingy, long lasting tartness, which the actual berries leave behind on the upper jaw. The fruit qualities in general arent totally over the top though, but create a nice interplay with the lambics tartness.

Sampled at Vill & Syrlig 2015. Almost clear deep reddish body with a small off-white head. Really nice aroma with typical Belgium lambic quality, barnyard, funk, acidity and just a hint of berries. Flavor is funky barnyard as well with balanced acidity, quite tart and a lovely subtle hint of blackberries. Very nice body and long lasting aftertaste. Complex, classic and something original.
Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshares meets Arla Unika. Deep red pour with tiny lacings. Notes of blackberries, cranberries, vanilla, leather, oak and some cherries.

Rating #50 of fruit lambics. Bottle thanks to valgren. Pours dark red with no head. Aroma of vinegar, blackberries, black currants, leather some funk and also very vinous. The taste is sour and fruity with notes of blackberry, black currants, leather, vinegar, red currants and some funky ness. The taste also has that vinous side to it. I really like this!

UPDATED: OCT 9, 2015 Bottle. Hazy purple body with a medium white head. Blackberries, funk, wood, vinegar, tartness, apple notes. Very good. 8, 4, 8, 4, 16
RE-RATE: Clear red body with a small head. Unripe blackberries, oak, funk, tart green apples, fresh pressed lemons. Delicious.
Bottle @ Jacob og Marias kulinariske paradis, Torpegården. Pours Hazy purple with a white head. Blueberries, funk, Wood and funk. Dry, tart and funky. Dope.
Bottle. Pours berry red white head. Nose/taste of blackberry, oak, acid funk and lemon - medium body.

Bottle thanks to Valgreen. Big want! Pours deep dark red with a medium pink head. Aromas of blackberries, funk, vinegar, tart red apples. Taste is blackberries, woody notes, tart, dry, tannins. Hot dauymn!

375 ml bottle shared by DrSilverworm. Pours a hazy reddish/purple/amber color with a small off white head. Bottle. Pour fizzy cloudy deep ruby with short lasting light pink head. Aroma is blackberries! some oxidation, ripe berries, fruity brett, hay, vinegar, funk, black currants, tart, some ribbon and earth grassy funk. Taste is sweet berries, then mega tart. At Richs Massive Cellar Emptying Tasting. The clear winner of our comparitive tasting between Jester King Chrysalis, Almanac Blackberry and Tilquin Mure. Bottle @ Fermentoren cph. With Lukas. Hazy ruby red, small white head that settles quickly. Aroma, funky, fruity, red berries, black current, grass, hay, . Taste of blackberry, oak, light char, taste gets a touch acetic but still delicious, finish gets acetic also, medium carbonation thats perfect and natural.

Poured from a 375 ml bottle. 
Aroma is rather gueuze-like with some moderately strong, earthy, herbal notes with a bit of hay. Some light citrus notes with medium light berry notes. Hints of oak. 
Pours a hazy purple with a light brownish hue and a small, fairly thin, pinkish head that recedes quickly to the edges where it lingers for a bit. Light lacing and small legs. 
Flavor is moderately acidic with a lot of gueuze character. Rather earthy and herbal with some light hay and horse blanket. Some moderate berry notes, but not jammy or sweet at all. Light citrus notes. Low oak character. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied but slightly watery with medium low carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth.

Awesome floral, classic gueuzy funk in the nose. Touch of sweat. Great oak. Wow, fantastic funk. Absolutely love the nose of this. Awesome sour-plus taste, nice more dry finish. Mild bit of savory. Very refreshing. Easy-drinking. So flavorful. Nice big floral in the taste. Lighter to medium body -- surprisingly light for the 6.4%. Very light carbonation. More dry in the end. Fantastic lambic. Not as sour as some of the top-rated fruit lambics. But I really appreciate the subtlety. Lets the lambic character shine.

(375ml 2015 bottle from Malt Attacks, Brussels, July 26th 2015) Pours murky dark pink-red with orangeish cast. Small short lived whitish head. Palate very tart blackberry and lemon juice, quite lactic, not super sour but still quite puckering. Hint of sweeter berry flesh, zesty in the middle. Finish a bit drier but still tart, funk a bit more restrained than the nose and blends with the softly bitter wood and leather character. Lemon zest in the aftertaste. Light body, just the right side of watery, very soft carb. Maybe this is a bit young still but its really promising, acidic berry lambic but not too lean. If the acid goes down and fruit and funk come up it will be killer.

Bottle (375 ml). Shared by Whatup14, thanks David! Split 2-ways.

Appearance: Cloudy ruby-ish pink with a small quickly vanishing off-white head, pinkish hues and little to no lacing. 

Aroma: Bright blackerries along nice funk, Tilquin usual lemony signature, earthy notes, barnyard, black raspberries and mild leafy presence.

Taste: Blackberries forward with nice funk and acidic features (without being too much), earthy notes, lemon, red berries, barnyard, leafy notes and mineral presence.

Palate: Medium body. Soft carbonation. Rather dry finish. Fruity aftertaste. A bit lemony as well. 

Overall: Another homerun from Tilquin. A bit more carbonation would help both the appearance and the palate but otherwise its a bright fruit lambic with a really nice balance. Super tasty stuff. Loved it.

Bottle from De Hopduvel. An utter rarity: this is a brambleberry lambic, apparently produced very limitedly. Loose and milky, very pale greyish head breaking in instants but retaining around the edges, colour is a beautiful, hazy magenta red, a tad darker and clearly more purplish than your average oude kriek. Interesting and somewhat weird aroma: less spritzy than I had expected, sour-sweet brambleberries indeed, amidst impressions of brambleberry yoghurt, red lambrusco, lime juice, fresh redcurrant, buttermilk, wet hay, roses and all the animalistic odours of fertilized farmland, barnyard, horse steak and horseblanket (not that I ever sniffed one, but you get my drift). In warming up, a deep, sweet cooked fruit aroma comes more forward, almost port- and jam-like and very agreeable.  Extremely fruity onset, the sourish sweetness of brambleberries is clearly there again if you know what they taste like, but a wild array of esters add a huge amount of complexity, as in any good fruit lambic; unripe plums, strawberries, fresh apple and a refined but feisty lemony acidity running through the whole. Carbonation is refinedly fizzy, as in a crémant. Soft basic wheat sourishness is there but some gentle, bready malts show up too, buried under the truckload of fruit and mellow, bacterial lactic acidity (sour yoghurt), with the lemony tartness drying the finish, very appetizing or in fact mouth watering; woody notes add further drought and a deep echo of earthy hops lends the whole a kind of sedate, late bitterness. Very juicy, sharpish, refined, brut and complexely fruity flavour - this is how any traditionally made fruit lambic should be. I like this a lot, it is a welcome distraction from the usual sour cherries but brambleberries apparently work equally well in a lambic. Hopefully this will stay in production. Classy!

Mauvish/deep purple pour with an earthy glaze to it, little to no head. Announces its unripe bramble fruit tartness in the young and vibrantly fruit-acidic nose: as if from berries plucked a week or two to early, reinforced by the sharp, natural lemon profile of the lambic underneath. Sample @1st Tilquin English Beer Festival +Open Doors  Rien quau nez, je retrouve la signature Tilquin: un équilibre bien maitrisé entre amertume et acidité. En bouche, je goûte dabord cette acidité, fine et bienveillante qui arrive sur la pointe de la langue et qui se prolonge par le houblonnage tout à la fois discret mais persistant. Le maltage fromenté est doux légèrement biscuité. Là où la Quetche pèche un peu sur les saveurs fruitées, la Mûres tient toutes ses promesses mais plutôt en arrière bouche avec une belle intensité quon lui connait. Ses saveurs fruitées accompagnent le houblonnage en laissant une belle longueur en bouche.

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2015 Couleur est foncée avec une palette versant sur le pourpre, cette dernière présentant un léger voile. Le col est généreux sans offrir une trop grande rétention, ce dernier offre un ton beige. 

Arôme se présente de manière évolutive depuis les premières dégustation, pour arriver à une étape plus optimale et qui fait bien ressortir le bouquet de la mûre sans verser dans un scénario maintes fois répéter par d?autres; càd dans le surfait, non-naturel. Je retrouve un fruité très intéressant et complexe mais avec un clair bouquet de gueuze qui laisse une balance entre les lambics et la mûre. 

Palais est agréablement fruité avec pour moi un profile fruité qui vient plus titiller la fin de bouche et ce profile somptueux de mûre tout en alternant un côté sec/poussiéreux moyennement aigre-acidulé de la gueuze. Sur les versions précédentes, je notais un fruité noir nettement plus en retrait, mais dont le côté suret restait présent, quant à cette version de la mûre, c?est surtout sa saveur, qui ici reprend le dessus en apportant un ajout acidulé appréciable. Palais reste bien pétillant venant touché le haut du palais sur un côté moyennement épicé/fruité. J?arrête ici car je n?ai pas vraiment pour habitude d?écrire autant sur une bière. 

Au final, une bière qui me plaît, énormément de par sa complexité mais aussi de par son goût évolutif qui en qcq mois montre déjà de subtiles signes de changement. Mon c?ur balance un peu entre la mûre et la questche, sans être aux antipodes l?une de l?autre, elles offrent assez de caractère et de raffinement pour évoluer de manière intéressante en cave. Reste la sempiternelle question de savoir quand déguster cette mûre ; fraîche ou avec un peu de bouteille.
